etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek trikeratos ‘three-horned’ + ōps ‘face’

definitions: a large quadrupedal herbivorous dinosaur living at the end of the Cretaceous period, having a massive head with two large horns, a smaller horn on the beaked snout, and a bony frill above the neck.

notes.text: Genus Triceratops, infraorder Ceratopsia, order Ornithischia

shortDefinitions: large quadrupedal herbivorous dinosaur living at end of Cretaceous period
